name: Emerald Lake Trail
description: A popular trail leading to a stunning alpine lake with breathtaking views of surrounding peaks. Known for its accessibility and beautiful scenery.

name: Bear Peak via Fern Canyon
description: A challenging ascent to Bear Peak offering panoramic views of Boulder and the plains. Steep sections and rocky terrain.

name: Lily Lake Loop
description: A short, accessible loop around a beautiful lake, perfect for families and a quick stroll. Offers stunning reflections of Longs Peak.

name: Flatirons Vista Trail
description: A relatively flat trail with excellent views of the iconic Flatirons. Great for a quick hike or run.

name: Sky Pond via Glacier Gorge Trail
description: A strenuous but rewarding hike to a breathtaking alpine lake surrounded by sheer cliffs. This trail takes you past several waterfalls and two other lakes.

name: Maroon Bells Scenic Loop Trail
description: An iconic, easy loop offering stunning views of the Maroon Bells, some of the most photographed mountains in North America.

name: Hanging Lake Trail
description: A short, steep, and rocky trail leading to a spectacular travertine lake with crystal-clear turquoise water and hanging gardens.

name: Garden of the Gods Loop Trail
description: A paved loop trail through a registered National Natural Landmark with stunning red rock formations.

name: Mount Bierstadt Trail
description: One of Colorado's most popular '14ers' (peaks over 14,000 feet), offering a relatively straightforward climb with rewarding summit views.

name: Chautauqua Trail
description: A classic Boulder hike that provides direct access to the Flatirons and a network of other trails.

name: Blue Lakes Trail
description: A challenging hike to three stunning alpine lakes with vibrant blue water, set in a basin surrounded by rugged peaks.

name: Ice Lakes Basin Trail
description: A strenuous hike to some of the most brilliantly blue lakes in Colorado. The trail is steep but the reward is unforgettable.

name: Devil's Head Lookout Trail
description: A popular hike to the last of the original Front Range fire lookout towers still in service. Offers 360-degree views.

name: Horsetooth Falls Trail
description: A family-friendly hike to a lovely waterfall, especially in the spring. Part of the Horsetooth Mountain Open Space.

name: The Incline Trail
description: A notoriously difficult hike that gains nearly 2,000 feet of elevation in less than a mile. A true test of endurance.

name: Quandary Peak Trail
description: A popular and relatively straightforward '14er' with stunning panoramic views from the summit.

name: Chicago Basin
description: A remote and challenging backpacking trip to a basin that provides access to three '14ers': Sunlight Peak, Windom Peak, and Eolus Peak.

name: Longs Peak - Keyhole Route
description: A challenging and iconic '14er' that requires scrambling and exposure. Not for the faint of heart.

name: Crater Lake Trail
description: A beautiful hike to a pristine alpine lake located at the base of the Maroon Bells.

name: Booth Falls Trail
description: A popular hike to a beautiful waterfall. The trail can be extended to Booth Lake for a more challenging day.

name: Bierstadt Lake Loop
description: A family-friendly hike to a beautiful subalpine lake with fantastic views of the Continental Divide.

name: St. Mary's Glacier
description: A short but steep hike to a semi-permanent snowfield (glacier) where you can ski and snowboard year-round.

name: Royal Arch Trail
description: A strenuous hike to a natural rock arch with great views of Boulder and the surrounding area.

name: Isabelle Peak
description: A challenging hike to a stunning summit with panoramic views of the Indian Peaks Wilderness.

name: Lost Man Lake Trail
description: A beautiful hike through a high alpine valley with stunning wildflowers and a good chance of seeing wildlife.

name: Herman Gulch Trail
description: A popular trail for wildflower viewing in the summer and snowshoeing in the winter.

name: Mayflower Gulch
description: A relatively easy hike through a beautiful valley with historic mining ruins.

name: McCullough Gulch Trail
description: A short but steep hike to a series of beautiful alpine lakes and waterfalls.

name: Pikes Peak via Barr Trail
description: A long and strenuous hike to the summit of one of Colorado's most famous '14ers'.

name: The Loch Vale Trail
description: A classic RMNP hike that takes you to a beautiful subalpine lake with stunning views of the surrounding peaks.

name: Mount Evans Scenic Byway
description: The highest paved road in North America, offering breathtaking views and opportunities to see wildlife.

name: Golden Gate Canyon State Park
description: A large state park with a variety of trails for hiking, biking, and horseback riding.

name: Roxborough State Park
description: A beautiful park with stunning red rock formations and a variety of easy trails.

name: Castlewood Canyon State Park
description: A unique park with a deep canyon, a river, and the ruins of a historic dam.

name: Staunton State Park
description: One of Colorado's newest state parks, with a variety of trails for hiking, biking, and rock climbing.

name: Eldorado Canyon State Park
description: A world-renowned rock climbing destination with a variety of challenging hiking trails.

name: Lory State Park
description: A beautiful park with a variety of trails for hiking, biking, and horseback riding, with great views of Horsetooth Reservoir.

name: Mueller State Park
description: A large park with a variety of trails for hiking, biking, and horseback riding, with great views of Pikes Peak.

name: Cheyenne Mountain State Park
description: A large park with a variety of trails for hiking, biking, and camping, with great views of the city.

name: State Forest State Park
description: A huge park with a variety of trails for hiking, biking, and off-roading, with a good chance of seeing moose.

name: Rifle Falls State Park
description: A small park with a stunning triple waterfall and a variety of easy trails.

name: Pearl Lake State Park
description: A beautiful park with a pristine mountain lake, perfect for fishing, kayaking, and paddleboarding.

name: Steamboat Lake State Park
description: A large park with a beautiful lake, perfect for boating, fishing, and swimming.

name: Sylvan Lake State Park
description: A beautiful park with a pristine mountain lake, perfect for fishing, kayaking, and paddleboarding.

name: Vega State Park
description: A large park with a beautiful reservoir, perfect for boating, fishing, and camping.

name: Crawford State Park
description: A beautiful park with a large reservoir, perfect for boating, fishing, and swimming.

name: Paonia State Park
description: A beautiful park with a large reservoir, perfect for boating, fishing, and water skiing.

name: Sweitzer Lake State Park
description: A small park with a large, shallow lake, perfect for boating, fishing, and bird watching.

name: Highline Lake State Park
description: A popular park with two lakes, perfect for boating, fishing, swimming, and camping.

name: James M. Robb - Colorado River State Park
description: A unique park with five sections along the Colorado River, perfect for rafting, kayaking, and fishing.

name: Mount Sanitas Trail
description: A popular and challenging loop trail offering panoramic views of Boulder and the surrounding plains.

name: Grays and Torreys Peaks Trail
description: A classic Colorado 14er hike, often done as a loop to bag two peaks. Offers stunning alpine scenery.

name: Garden of the Gods - Palmer Trail
description: A less crowded trail in Garden of the Gods, offering different perspectives of the iconic red rock formations.

name: Brainard Lake Loop
description: A beautiful and accessible loop around Brainard Lake, with stunning views of the Indian Peaks Wilderness.

name: Hanging Lake Winter Trail
description: The winter route to Hanging Lake, requiring microspikes or snowshoes. Offers a unique, serene experience.

name: Bear Lake Trail
description: A very popular, accessible loop trail around beautiful Bear Lake, offering stunning views of Hallett Peak and Longs Peak.

name: Alberta Falls Trail
description: A short, scenic hike to a beautiful waterfall, popular for families and those looking for a quick nature escape.

name: Dream Lake Trail
description: A stunning hike to a picturesque alpine lake, offering incredible reflections of the surrounding peaks.

name: Lake Haiyaha Trail
description: A beautiful trail leading to a unique, turquoise-colored lake surrounded by a boulder field.

name: Skyline Traverse
description: A challenging and iconic traverse of the peaks above Boulder, offering incredible views and a true test of endurance.

name: Royal Arch Trail - Longer Loop
description: An extended version of the Royal Arch Trail, offering more mileage and varied terrain with equally rewarding views.

name: Mount Falcon Castle Trail
description: A historic trail leading to the ruins of a castle, offering great views of the Denver skyline and surrounding mountains.

name: Red Rocks Trading Post Trail
description: A short, easy loop trail around the iconic Red Rocks Amphitheatre, perfect for a quick stroll and scenic views.

name: Garden of the Gods - Siamese Twins Trail
description: A short, easy trail leading to the unique Siamese Twins rock formation, with a natural window framing Pikes Peak.

name: Manitou Incline - Descent Route
description: The designated descent route for the Manitou Incline, offering a more gradual return through a scenic forest.
